title: Param Shopping Marketing App - Frontend Implementation

requirements.summary: Create a marketing landing page with hero, features, CTA, and footer sections
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays 'Param Shopping' as the app name prominently
Hero section includes a compelling tagline and primary CTA button
Features section lists at least 3 shopping app benefits with icons or visuals
Page is fully responsive on mobile, tablet, and desktop

file_operations.description: Create the main marketing landing page component that fetches marketing content from the backend and renders hero, features, CTA, and footer sections. Reference the generated hero banner image at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1440x600.png in the hero section. Reference the generated logo at frontend/public/assets/generated/param-shopping-logo.dim_256x256.png in the header/hero area. Ensure full responsiveness across mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

Create a hero section component that displays the app name, tagline, and primary CTA button over the hero-banner.dim_1440x600.png background image. Accept appName, tagline, and ctaText as props. Ensure the section is fully responsive and visually prominent.

Create a features section component that accepts an array of feature strings and renders them with icons or visual indicators. Display at least 3 features in a grid or list layout. Ensure responsive design across all screen sizes.
Create a call-to-action section component with a prominent button (e.g., 'Download Now' or 'Get Started'). Accept ctaText as a prop. Style it to be attention-grabbing and conversion-focused.

Create a footer component that displays the 'com.paramshopping.app' branding consistently. Include any additional footer content as needed (e.g., links, legal text). Ensure it is styled according to the theme.

Create a custom React hook that fetches marketing content from the backend using the getMarketingContent method. Return the content (appName, tagline, features, ctaText) and loading/error states. Use the backend interface defined in frontend/src/backend.d.ts.
Update the App component to render the LandingPage component as the main route. Remove any placeholder content and ensure the landing page is displayed by default when users visit the app.

requirements.summary: Apply a vibrant, modern e-commerce visual theme with warm accent colors and clean typography
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent color palette with warm accent tones used throughout
Typography is clean and readable with clear visual hierarchy
All sections follow the same design language
Visual theme feels appropriate for a shopping/retail app

file_operations.description: Define global CSS custom properties for the vibrant e-commerce theme using warm accent colors (orange, red, coral tones). Set up primary, secondary, and accent color variables. Define typography scale and font families using clean sans-serif fonts. Ensure the theme variables are accessible throughout the app.

Extend the Tailwind configuration to include custom theme colors matching the warm accent palette (orange, red, coral tones). Add custom font families for clean sans-serif typography. Configure spacing, border radius, and shadow utilities to support a modern, energetic design language.

Create a layout component that wraps all page content and enforces the visual theme consistently. Apply global styling, background colors, and padding/margins to ensure a cohesive design language across all sections.
